en: I gave the beggar what money I had.
ko: 가진 돈을 다 그 거지한테 줬어.

en: I was abashed when my mistakes were pointed out.
I want to build up my vocabulary.
I chose to leave instead of staying behind.
I was bidden to stay behind.
I'll join you later.
I'll follow.
I have been reading a book all morning.
I've been vacuuming the rooms all morning.
I have been writing letters all morning.
I felt a bit tired from swimming all morning.
I work hard in the garden in the morning.
I'm on duty from 9:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.
I'm going to leave about ten in the morning.
I take a walk at two in the afternoon.
I arrived at the stadium at 4:00 p.m., but the game had already started.
ko: 오후 4시에 경기장에 도착했는데 게임이 이미 시작됐더라.

en: I slept the whole afternoon away.
I'm not free to go this afternoon.
I spent the afternoon painting a picture.
I am free this afternoon.
I have been reading books all afternoon.
I've been reading that book all afternoon.
ko: 오후 내내 그 책 읽고 있었어.

en: I have been reading the book all afternoon.
I studied for a while in the afternoon.
We had to cooperate with each other.
I have been studying English for five years.
I will finish the work in five days.
I aimed at the tiger and fired, but missed him.
I had my photo taken on the shore of the lake.
I swept up dead leaves.
I wrote a letter to my parents at home.
I had the door mended.
I had the door repaired.
I put a new handle to the door.
I like to go to a cabin in the woods to enjoy solitude.
ko: 혼자만의 시간을 즐기러 숲속 오두막에 가는 걸 좋아해.

en: I felt lonely.
I'm getting along with my mother-in-law very well.
I am bound to him by a close friendship.
I ran across a rare book in a secondhand bookstore.
ko: 중고 서점에서 희귀한 책을 우연히 발견했어.

en: I'm very interested in classical literature.
I traded old newspapers for toilet paper.
I saw an old friend of mine.
I met an old friend of mine.
I keep old books with care.
I like my old brass tea pot.
ko: 내 오래된 놋쇠 주전자가 마음에 들어.

en: I bought an old car.
I traded in my old car for a new one.
ko: 타던 차를 주고 새 차로 바꿨어.

en: I have an old bicycle.
I bought an old lamp.
I bid ten dollars for the old stove.
I, for one, don't like pictures like this.
ko: 난 개인적으로 이런 사진 별로 안 좋아해.

en: I refused it for private reasons.
I, for one, am for the plan.
I chose a word carefully.
I didn't know how to express myself.
I can convey my feelings in words.
ko: 내 감정을 말로 표현할 수 있어.

en: I only did as I was told.
Modern art has no interest for me.
ko: 현대 미술은 나한테 아무런 흥미가 없어.

en: I'm not interested in modern art.
Modern art doesn't interest me.
I really can't understand modern sculpture.
ko: 현대 조각은 진짜 이해가 안 가.

en: I went to the theater to see a modern drama.
I must admit I don't like much contemporary music.
ko: 솔직히 현대 음악은 별로 안 좋아해.

en: I am content with my current position.
I must be content with my present salary.
I don't have any cash about me.
I don't have any cash on me.
I heard the front doorbell ring.
I went up to the front door.
I'm trying to lose weight.
I'm very much in favor of cutting taxes.
I was brought up under rigid discipline.
I am getting on well.
I forgot the key and went back for it.
I broke down the door because I lost the key.
I asked for the key and went upstairs to my room.
ko: 열쇠 달라고 해서 내 방으로 올라갔어.

en: I have lost the key.
I've lost my key.
It seems that I have lost my keys.
It seems that I've lost my keys.
I have lost my key.
I've come to see the sights.
I saw a stranger steal into his house.
ko: 어떤 낯선 사람이 그 사람 집으로 몰래 들어가는 걸 봤어.

en: I saw a stranger enter that house.
ko: 어떤 낯선 사람이 그 집으로 들어가는 걸 봤어.

en: I looked around, but saw nobody.
When he saw me, he pretended to be asleep.
I bought every book on Japan I could find.
ko: 일본에 관한 책은 보이는 대로 다 샀어.

en: I got hurt in the shoulder.
I felt myself touched on the shoulder.
I have a stiff shoulder.
I concentrated my effort on the study.
I went about with my dog.
I tied my dog to the tree in the yard.
I made my dog lie down.
I have a dog.
I saw a dog. The dog held a piece of meat in its mouth.
ko: 개를 한 마리 봤는데, 입에 고기 한 점을 물고 있더라.

en: I keep a dog.
I have a dog and two cats.
ko: 개 한 마리랑 고양이 두 마리 키워.

en: I prefer cats to dogs.
I don't like dogs.
I like dogs better than cats, because the former are more faithful than the latter.
ko: 난 고양이보다 강아지가 더 좋아. 강아지가 더 충성스럽거든.

en: I like a dog better than a cat, for the former is more faithful than the latter.
ko: 난 고양이보다 강아지가 더 좋아. 강아지가 더 충성스러우니까.

en: I fed some meat to my dog.
I feed meat to my dog.
I gave the dog a bone, stopping its barking.
ko: 강아지한테 뼈다귀를 줬더니 짖는 걸 멈췄어.

en: I gave the dog a bone. That stopped its barking.
ko: 강아지한테 뼈다귀를 줬어. 그랬더니 안 짖더라고.

en: I saw a dog swim across the river.
ko: 강아지가 강을 헤엄쳐서 건너가는 걸 봤어.

en: I like dogs, but my sister likes cats.
ko: 난 강아지 좋아하는데 우리 언니는 고양이 좋아해.

en: I am afraid of dogs.
I'm afraid of dogs.
I'm scared of dogs.
I went to the hospital to have my eyes tested.
He had a gun on his person.
I tried to stop their quarrel eagerly.
ko: 걔네 싸우는 거 말리려고 엄청 노력했어.

en: I tried my best to get them to stop quarreling.
I tried very hard to put an end to their heated argument.
I prepared for the game by training hard.
I call architecture frozen music.
I want to put an end to the quarrel.
I go to the same school as Kenji.
I had a physical checkup.
I take my health seriously.
I gave up smoking for health.
I stopped smoking for the sake of my health.
I want to live as long as I can stay in good health.
ko: 건강하게 살 수 있는 한 오래 살고 싶어.

en: I am blessed with good health.
I asked Ken to help me.
I exercise because I want to stay healthy.
I invited Ken, Bill and Yumi.
I lent the record to Ken.
I want to travel to the moon.
I expect that I will see him on Monday.
ko: 월요일에 그 사람 만날 것 같아.

en: I plan to see him on Monday.
I study English on Monday and Friday.
I am given a monthly allowance of fifty thousand yen.
ko: 한 달에 용돈으로 오만 엔씩 받아.

en: I never fail to write to my mother once a month.
ko: 한 달에 한 번은 꼭 엄마한테 편지 써.

en: I go to Hiroshima three times a month.
ko: 한 달에 세 번 히로시마에 가.

en: I go to the barber's once a month.
ko: 한 달에 한 번 미용실 가.

en: I go to the movies once a month.
ko: 한 달에 한 번 영화 보러 가.

en: I tried to imagine life on the moon.
ko: 달에서 사는 건 어떨지 상상해 봤어.

en: I rent a room by the month.
I consulted with my sister about my marriage.
ko: 내 결혼에 대해서 우리 언니랑 상담했어.

en: I'm married.
After I got married, my Japanese got better and I could understand more.
ko: 결혼하고 나서 일본어가 늘어가지고 더 많이 알아듣게 됐어.

en: That's fine with me.
I can hold my liquor.
I failed after all.
I trust that, in the long run, I will not be a loser.
ko: 결국에는 내가 패배자가 되지 않을 거라고 믿어.

en: I can't tie a very good knot.
I took a picture at the decisive moment.
I'm very slow at making up my mind.
I was too embarrassed to look her in the eye.
ko: 너무 창피해서 그 여자 눈을 못 쳐다봤어요.

en: Never did I tell her that I loved her.
ko: 그 사람한테 사랑한다고 말한 적 한 번도 없어요.

en: I don't dislike him at all.
I never eat meat.
I'm anything but bright.
I am by no means absent from this class because I am lazy.
ko: 게을러서 이 수업에 빠진 게 절대 아니에요.

en: I never get seasick because I am used to traveling by boat.
ko: 배 타는 게 익숙해서 배멀미는 전혀 안 해요.

en: I'll never lose hope.
I adhered to my decision.
I make it a rule never to eat between meals.
ko: 식사 사이에 간식은 절대 안 먹는 게 제 원칙이에요.

en: I'll never do anything by halves.
ko: 무슨 일이든 절대 어중간하게 하지 않아요.

en: I am anything but a liar.
I am far from satisfied with the result.
I never try to go to there.
ko: 거기 갈 생각은 절대 안 해요.

en: I never say what is not true.
I'll never let you down.
I am far from blaming you.
I'll never forget your kindness.
ko: 친절하게 대해주신 거 절대 잊지 않을게요.

en: I never give up.
I would have been shot.
I met with my teacher in the theater.
I like to see comedy in the theater.
ko: 영화관에서 코미디 영화 보는 거 좋아해요.

en: I sat behind a very tall man in the theater.
ko: 극장에서 키가 아주 큰 남자 뒤에 앉았어요.

en: I sat behind a very tall person at the theater.
ko: 극장에서 키가 아주 큰 사람 뒤에 앉았어요.

en: I work in the field of art.
I felt a light touch on my shoulder.
ko: 어깨에 누가 살짝 손을 대는 게 느껴졌어요.

en: I ate a light lunch.
I like light shoes.
I was hit by the policeman.
I tried to get in touch with the police.
I asked a policeman for directions.
I told the policeman what I knew.
I didn't just make the plan, I carried it out.
ko: 계획만 세운 게 아니라 바로 실천에 옮겼어요.

en: I had to change my plans.
I had to change the plan.
I am in financial difficulties.
I am economically independent of my parents.
I saw Keiko playing tennis after school.
ko: 방과 후에 케이코가 테니스 치는 걸 봤어요.

en: I cannot but give up my brother for lost.
I've given up my brother for dead.
I carefully explored the contract.
I am not so diligent as my brother.
I went to the station to see my brother off.
I'm proud of my brother.
I lent my coat to a friend of my brother.
I came to Tokyo from Osaka counting on my brother's help.
ko: 형의 도움을 믿고 오사카에서 도쿄로 왔어요.

en: I had my brother repair my bicycle.
I went to the movies with my brother.
I went to the cinema with my brother.
I played tennis with my brother.
I have one brother.
I have one elder brother and a younger sister.
ko: 오빠 한 명이랑 여동생 한 명 있어.

en: I have one older brother and one younger sister.
ko: 오빠 한 명이랑 여동생 한 명 있어.

en: I have an older brother and a younger sister.
ko: 오빠 한 명이랑 여동생 한 명 있어.

en: I have confidence in you.
I'll do whatever I can to help you.
ko: 내가 도울 수 있는 건 뭐든 할게.

en: I can't help you. Do your assignment yourself.
ko: 못 도와줘. 숙제는 네가 직접 해.

en: I'll stand up for you.
I'd better drive you home.
It's better if I drove you all the way home.
ko: 집까지 내가 태워다 주는 게 낫겠어.

en: I'll never fail you.
I want to make you work harder.
ko: 네가 더 열심히 하게 만들고 싶어.

en: I didn't want to bring you in.
ko: 너를 이 일에 끌어들이고 싶지 않았어.

en: I'm taller than you.
I don't want to have you involved in the trouble.
ko: 너를 이 일에 엮이게 하고 싶지 않아.

en: I'm much younger than you.
I have ten more pens than you.
ko: 내가 너보다 펜 열 자루 더 많아.

en: I am not as interested in literature as you.
I'm not as interested in literature as you.
I'm not as interested in literature as you are.
I'm looking forward to seeing you and your family.
ko: 너랑 네 가족들 만나는 거 기대돼.

en: I am not more careful than you are.
ko: 내가 너보다 더 조심성이 많은 건 아니야.

en: I cannot follow your theory.
I cannot follow your logic.
I am tempted to doubt your friendship.
I am fully convinced of your innocence.
I defer to your judgement.
I agree to your proposal.
I have the same dictionary as your brother has.
ko: 나 네 형이랑 똑같은 사전 있어.

en: I may write a letter for you.
ko: 내가 너 대신 편지 써줄 수도 있어.

en: I can assure you of your success.
I can't be unconcerned about your future.
ko: 네 미래가 걱정 안 될 수가 없어.

en: I like your car.
I love your car.
I don't quite know how it happened.
I'm thinking about you.
I'm very impressed by your work.
I shall want an explanation of your behavior.
I took your word for it.
I know the person you are talking about.
I'm not so simple as to believe you.
ko: 난 너를 믿을 만큼 단순하지 않아.

en: I am all ears to what you say.
ko: 네 말 귀 기울여 듣고 있어.

en: I worry about your health.
I don't object to your plan.
I can't follow the course of your argument.
I am assured of your help.
I am pleased with your present.
I couldn't but be irritated with you.
I like you very much.
I met your girlfriend.
I know your father.
I know your father very well.
I don't need any bit of your charity.
ko: 네 동정 따위 눈곱만큼도 필요 없어.

en: I know your brother very well.
I know your older brother quite well.
I told him what I had told you.
I always had my eye on you.
I want you to see her.
ko: 네가 그 여자애 좀 만나봤으면 좋겠어.

en: I can't let you talk about your own father that way.
ko: 네 아버님에 대해 그런 식으로 말하게 둘 순 없어.

en: I advise you to be punctual.
ko: 시간 좀 잘 지키라고 말해주고 싶어.

en: I recommend that you should buy a learner's dictionary.
ko: 학습용 사전 하나 사는 걸 추천해.

en: I am counting on you to give the opening address.
ko: 개회사는 네가 맡아줄 거라고 믿고 있을게.

en: I want to see you.
I owe everything to you.
I don't like your going there by yourself.
ko: 너 혼자 거기 가는 거 싫어.

en: I mean you no harm.
I will give you a notebook.
I can't let you do that.
I may have told you such a thing, but I don't remember it at all.
ko: 너한테 그런 말 했을지도 모르겠는데, 전혀 기억이 안 나.

en: I'd like you to go there.
I want you to come at once.
I may have told you this story before.
ko: 이 얘기 전에 한 적 있을지도 몰라.

en: I may have discussed this with you before.
ko: 이거 전에 너랑 얘기해본 적 있을지도 몰라.

en: I want you to read this letter.
I want you to read this English letter.
I want you to stay here longer.
ko: 여기 좀 더 오래 있었으면 좋겠어.

en: How much do I owe you?
I want you to play the guitar for me.
I don't mind lending some money to you.
ko: 너한테 돈 좀 빌려주는 건 괜찮아.

en: I want to ask a favor of you.
I owe you 3,000 yen.
I came to the same decision as you.
I'd love to come with you.
I do not agree with you at all.
ko: 난 네 의견에 전혀 동의 안 해.

en: I'm looking forward to seeing you again.
ko: 우리 다시 만나는 거 기대하고 있을게.

en: I was surprised at you and your brother appearing on TV.
ko: 너랑 네 형이 TV에 나온 거 보고 깜짝 놀랐어.

en: I expect you all to do your best.
I didn't blame you for hitting him.
ko: 걔 때린 거 가지고 너 탓하지 않았어.

en: I think it necessary for you to see him.
ko: 네가 걔를 만나보는 게 좋을 것 같아.

en: I think it's necessary for you to see him.
ko: 네가 걔를 꼭 만나봐야 할 것 같아.

en: I think you need to see him.
ko: 네가 걔를 좀 만나볼 필요가 있어.

en: I want the same style of jacket as yours.
ko: 네 거랑 똑같은 스타일 재킷 갖고 싶어.

en: I believe you are honest.
I am not wholly convinced that you are right.
ko: 네 말이 맞다고 완전히 확신할 수는 없어.

en: I am very glad to hear of your success.
ko: 네 성공 소식 들으니 정말 기뻐.

en: I'll never forget what you told me.
ko: 네가 나한테 한 말 절대 안 잊을게.

en: I heard you talking in your sleep last night.
I want the same dictionary as you have.
I don't have as much money as you think I do.
ko: 네 생각만큼 나 돈 많지 않아.

en: I regret saying that you were wrong.
I can't do such a thing like you did.
I am not pleased with what you have done.
ko: 네가 한 일 별로 마음에 안 들어.

en: I don't know where you're from, and neither does he.
ko: 너 어디 출신인지 나도 모르고 걔도 몰라.

en: I think it necessary that you should do so.
I don't like your coming late every time.
ko: 너 매번 늦게 오는 거 싫어.

en: I think you made up that story about the accident.
ko: 그 사고 얘기 네가 지어낸 것 같아.

en: I am afraid of bears.
I had my shoes cleaned.
I had my shoes shined.
I must buy a pair of shoes.
I've worn out my shoes.
I got my shoes wet.
I had my shoes mended at that store.
I loosened my shoelaces.
I met her at the station by accident.
I came upon an old friend of mine on the train.
It chanced that I met him at the airport.
I met her by accident at the bus stop.
I met an old friend by chance in Kyoto.
I came to Liverpool by chance.
I chanced to be working there.
I found the book by chance.
I met Jane by accident.
I am a hungry spider.
I was too hungry to speak.
I felt faint with hunger.
I waste a lot of time daydreaming.
I went to the airport to see my mother off.
I have a picture of an airport.
I indulged in some duty-free shopping at the airport.
I met a friend of mine at the airport.
I chanced to meet him at the airport.
I went into the air force.
I can no more swim than I can fly.
ko: 내가 수영을 못 하는 건 날지 못하는 거랑 똑같아.

en: I saw a strange moving object in the sky.
ko: 하늘에서 이상한 물체가 움직이는 걸 봤어.

en: I was foolish enough to leave my commutation ticket at home.
I was foolish enough to believe it.
ko: 그걸 믿다니 나도 참 바보 같았어.

en: I have no faith in a silly superstition.
I complained, but they refused to take this sweater back.
ko: 항의해 봤는데 이 스웨터 환불 안 해준대.

en: I worked my way through college.
I have a fancy for bitter things.
I have never been to Kyushu.
I'm from Fukuoka in Kyushu.
I will finish my homework by nine.
I went to the bank to withdraw $20,000 from deposit.
I'm going to the bank.
I have to go to the bank.
I've got to go to the bank.
I opened my account with the bank.
I work for a bank.
I worked for a bank.
I exchanged some yen for dollars at the bank.
I have several silver coins.
I collect silver tea spoons.
I went there for the express purpose of earning money.
I'm not rich, nor do I wish to be.
ko: 난 부자도 아니고, 되고 싶지도 않아.

en: I am not rich, nor do I wish to be.
ko: 난 부자도 아니고, 되고 싶지도 않아.

en: I was a rich man.
I'm not rich but have so much to offer.
ko: 난 부자는 아니지만 해줄 수 있는 게 많아.

en: I put the money in a three-year time deposit at the bank.
I would choose honor before money.
I have neither money nor friends.
I don't have any money and I don't have any friends either.
ko: 난 돈도 하나도 없고 친구도 없어.

en: Though I have neither money nor friends, I am not so unhappy as you think.
ko: 돈도 친구도 없지만, 네 생각만큼 불행하진 않아.

en: I need money badly.
I don't like the idea that money is everything.
I will call on him one of these days.
I'm on good terms with the neighbors.
I had an interesting conversation with my neighbor.
